review_title: Great place to work, pay is low, but cost of living is reasonable and makes up for the gap.
pros: Great people, ambitious leaders, a compelling mission. Smart students.
cons: Location (relative to Toronto), low pay (although the cost of living is lower in London, so the low salary goes a lot further than you think)

review_title: Discriminatory, toxic work environment.  Haven for narcissists.
cons:
The "Leaders with Heart" slogan is a joke! 
Instructors are constantly micro-managed and scrutinized, often bullied and harassed; some of them openly discriminated. 
Questionable hiring practices for faculty. 
Obedience is valued over critical thinking.

job_title: Student Brand Ambassador in London, ON
pros:
Flexible work hours
Amazing team
Welcomes innovative ideas 
Build professional network
cons: No cons, the support you receive to carry out your task and vision is really good

pros:
Amazing work culture
Flexibility 
Allows creativity

review_title: Various jobs, could use more pay
pros:
-Various jobs. You are hired on by a specific professor to do what THEY want you to do, so there's lots of opportunity to find something you like

-Many profs allow you to make your own hours, so you can work around your schedule

-You will make contacts and references at this sort of position

-GREAT FOR STUDENTS (only available to students, anyway.)

-UWO is a wonderful environment with great staff. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY.
cons: -Only 0.50 cents above minimum wage, for workers who the school knows are educated

pros: friendly college, professional professors, Good academic place to work in academic area and get experience
cons: Not all student in same level of English proficiency
